channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: OSG asks SC to junk temporary release petition of vulnerable, at-risk prisoners
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: Detention facilities that have reported at least one confirmed COVID-19 case include the New Bilibid Prison, Quezon City Jail, Cebu City Jail, and the Correctional Institution for Women.

item.title: COVID-19 recoveries in Philippines approach 800 as infection total jumps to 7,294
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: Over 2.62 million cases of COVID-19 including almost 182,000 deaths have been recorded globally by the World Health Organization in its latest situation report.

item.title: Voter registration suspended until June 30, voter’s certification until April 30
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: However, the issuance of Voter's Certification will only remain suspended until April 30 "or until such time that the ECQ shall have been lifted by proper authorities.”

item.title: Almost 20,000 OFWs evacuated, thousands more to be repatriated amid COVID-19 — DFA
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: Seafarers comprise most of the repatriates, with a total of 15,130 workers coming from 75 cruise ships. The remainder are 4,336 land-based OFWs.

item.title: Ragos conferred military honors ahead of Sunday burial at Libingan ng mga Bayani
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: The 34-year-old army veteran received military honors today ahead of his hero’s burial set tomorrow noon.

item.title: House leaders slam slow distribution of cash aid
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: House leaders yesterday expressed dissatisfaction with the distribution of cash aid to beneficiaries targeted by the Bayanihan to Heal as One law that they passed last month.

item.title: DICT to lower spectrum user’s fee for telcos
item.author: Rainier Allan Ronda
item.description: The Department of Information and Communications Technology will lower the spectrum user’s fee for telecommunication companies on their fixed WiFi internet connectivity services to homes and offices as a move to encourage telcos to improve the speed, accessibility and cost of their services to Filipino homes, especially during the extended enhanced community quarantine in most parts of the country due to the coronavirus disease pandemic.

item.title: Duterte to ask for additional budget to fight COVID-19
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: President Duterte is asking Congress for a supplemental budget after the finance department admitted that funds might be stretched thin in the fight against the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: P14 million worth of local test kits procured by OVP
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: The office of Vice President Leni Robredo has procured P14 million worth of locally developed test kits to help contain the spread of coronavirus disease 2019 in the country.

item.title: COVID experience may jump-start ‘balik probinsiya’
item.description: Sen. Bong Go said the whole government should learn from the experiences encountered during the coronavirus crisis in order to provide long-term solutions that would put a stop to the current public health emergency and avoid the further spread of such diseases in the future.
